data.title: Fizz nor Buzz
data.statement:
Two people are playing a series of matchstick games. 

Every game starts with [[M]] matchsticks on a pile. Then, in turns, the players take {{1}}, {{2}} or {{3}} matches from the pile.
The player to take the last matchstick loses the game.

However, there's a twist: when the number of sticks gets to a value that Fizzes or Buzzes (multiples of {{3}} and {{5}} respectively) the player whose turn it was loses the game as well. (This only applies after a player takes a turn, so when a game starts at a Fizzing or Buzzing number this doesn't effect the wins/loses of the players.)

When a game ends the number of matches is reset to [[M]] and the next player starts. E.g. the example contains two games consisting of six turns in total.

Provide the number of games each player wins. Note that the players are not perfect players.
data.constraints:
0 ≤ [[M]] ≤ 100
0 ≤ [[N]] ≤ 1000
The number of matches on the pile will not get negative.
data.stubGenerator:
read M:int
read N:int

loop N read x:int

write 0 0
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[M]] for the number of matches the game starts with.
<<Line 2:>> An integer [[N]] for the number of moves the players play in total.
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> The number of matches taken by the player whose turn it is.
data.outputDescription:
A single line containing two numbers:
- the number of games won by the player who took the first turn,
- the number of games won by the player who didn't take the first turn.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Two people are playing a series of matchstick games.

Every game starts with M matchsticks on a pile. Then, in turns, the players take 1, 2 or 3 matches from the pile.
The player to take the last matchstick loses the game.

However, there's a twist: when the number of sticks gets to a value that Fizzes or Buzzes (multiples of 3 and 5 respectively) the player whose turn it was loses the game as well. (This only applies after a player takes a turn, so when a game starts at a Fizzing or Buzzing number this doesn't effect the wins/loses of the players.)

When a game ends the number of matches is reset to M and the next player starts. E.g. the example contains two games consisting of six turns in total.

Provide the number of games each player wins. Note that the players are not perfect players.
Input
Line 1: An integer M for the number of matches the game starts with.
Line 2: An integer N for the number of moves the players play in total.
Next N lines: The number of matches taken by the player whose turn it is.
Output
A single line containing two numbers:
- the number of games won by the player who took the first turn,
- the number of games won by the player who didn't take the first turn.
Constraints
0 ≤ M ≤ 100
0 ≤ N ≤ 1000
The number of matches on the pile will not get negative.
Example
Input
4
6
2
1
1
2
1
1
Output
1 1
